title: Ticket #5603: Set supplemental groups properly when using SOFT_UID_DOMAIN
description: Always call setgroups() when switching to user privilege state, even when we have a UID/GID but no username. We may not have a user account name when the user account is set via set_user_ids() using a UID/GID pair. This mainly happens when SOFT_UID_DOMAIN=True (indicating that machines share a UID domain, but execute machines may not have comprehensive user account lists). Always calling setgroups() ensures we have a proper set of supplemental groups.
